title: Event Count module
text: hierarchical_count_table features following tables: hierarchy table arranged highest lowest event count normalized population. supports bookmarking.

title: Event Count module
text: dv.tables::mod_hierarchical_count_table() module uses several arguments following mandatory rest optional. part app creation, app creator specify values arguments applicable. Mandatory Arguments module_id : unique identifier type character module app. subjid_var: common column across datasets uniquely identify subjects. default: “SUBJID” table_dataset_name: dataset contains events per row. example, ADAE pop_dataset_name: dataset contains one row per subject total population. example, ADSL expects dataset structure similar https://www.cdisc.org/kb/examples/adam-subject-level-analysis-adsl-dataset-80283806 , one record per subject expects contain, least, subjid_var Refer dv.tables::mod_hierarchical_count_table() complete list arguments description.

title: Event Count module
text: set menus allows select hierarchy, groupings settings table.

title: Event Count module
text: collapsable hierarchy table.

what: Creating a hierarchical count table application
title: Event Count module
code: requireNamespace("pharmaverseadam")  adsl_dataset <- pharmaverseadam::adsl %>%   dplyr::mutate(     dplyr::across(       dplyr::where(is.character), as.factor     )   )  adae_dataset <- pharmaverseadam::adae %>%   dplyr::mutate(     dplyr::across(       dplyr::where(is.character), as.factor     )   )  dv.manager::run_app(   data = list(dummy = list(adsl = adsl_dataset, adae = adae_dataset)),   module_list = list(     "AE Hierarchy Table" = dv.tables::mod_hierarchical_count_table(       module_id = "hierarchical_count_table",       table_dataset_name = "adae",       pop_dataset_name = "adsl"     )   ),   filter_data = "adsl",   filter_key = "USUBJID" )

title: Event Count module
text: module allows downloading table excel. downloaded table, total count patients (N = seen selected group’s column header) shown column name. Additionally, selected group variable’s metrics split two columns every group item, {group item}_N show count value {group item}_per show relative percentage.

title: Event Count module
text: module shows default subject ID subjects given cell. also capacity returning list subjids modules. use case prefer complex interaction, example passing given ID another module (e.g. dv.papo) please let us know open issue repo!

title: Computes an event table with subject counts and percentages — compute_events_table

title: Computes an event table with subject counts and percentages — compute_events_table
text: event_df data.frame data frame containing event data. columns corresponding subjects, hierarchy levels, group variables. pop_df data.frame data frame containing population data. must columns corresponding subjects group variables. hierarchy character(1) character vector column names event_df use hierarchy. Can one two levels. group_var character(1) string representing column name pop_df used grouping population data. subjid_var character(1) string representing subject identifier column name. column must present event_df pop_df. .special_char character(1) special character used internally naming processing hierarchy levels. Default "\u001D". columns must factors

title: Computes an event table with subject counts and percentages — compute_events_table
text: list containing: df: data frame processed event data, including counts percentages. meta: list containing metadata related hierarchy, group variable, subject counts.

code: hierarchical_count_table_ui(id)  hierarchical_count_table_server(   id,   table_dataset,   pop_dataset,   subjid_var,   show_modal_on_click = FALSE,   default_hierarchy = NULL,   default_group = NULL,   intended_use_label = NULL )  mod_hierarchical_count_table(   module_id,   table_dataset_name,   pop_dataset_name,   subjid_var = "USUBJID",   show_modal_on_click = FALSE,   default_hierarchy = NULL,   default_group = NULL,   intended_use_label =     "Use only for internal review and monitoring during the conduct of clinical trials.",   receiver_id = NULL )

title: Invoke hierarchical_count_table module — hierarchical_count_table_ui
text: id character(0) ID event count module instance. table_dataset data.frame reactive dataset containing event data. pop_dataset data.frame reactive dataset containing population data. subjid_var character(1) string representing subject identifier column datasets. show_modal_on_click logical(1) flag indicate whether clicking table cell display modal dialog subject IDs. default_hierarchy character(1|2)|NULL default value hierarchy variables (optional). default_group character(1)|NULL default value group variable (optional). intended_use_label Either string indicating intended use export, NULL. provided label displayed prior download also included exported file. module_id [character(1)] Module Shiny id table_dataset_name, pop_dataset_name [character(1)] Name dataset receiver_id character(1) functionality ready yet please open issue contact developers interested using . table_dataset_disp, pop_dataset_disp [mm_dispatcher(1)] Dataset dispatcher. parameter incompatible *_dataset_name counterpart. advanced use.

title: Build a collection of named constants — pack_of_constants
text: Shiny uses strings IDs link UI server elements. E.g: foo_UI(id = ns("foo")) ... foo_server(id = "foo") pattern makes easy programmers fall trap modifying one instance string literal "foo" without modifying rest unaware problem bug hit. also easy mistakes uses "foo" identifier uses (text labels, ...) , often case, parameter explicitly named. One easy fix consists using global variables instead plain string literals. case previous example, mean: ID_FOO <- "foo" foo_UI(ns(ID_FOO)) ... foo_server(ID_FOO) simple addition makes purpose ID_FOO clear also fails gracefully ID_FOO instances updated synchronously along codebase. drawback polluting global namespace identifier variables. easily solved creating container constants, purpose pack_of_constants alias. ID <- pack_of_constants(FOO = "foo", BAR = "bar") ID$FOO "foo" ID$BA Error $.pack_of_constants(ID, BA) : Pack constants "ID" contain "BA" pack constants plain named list enforces elements unique, non-null names. tagged S3 object override extraction operators. use checkmate unnecessary, Good Library(TM) module rely anyways
